title: handwriting font
content:
is a font or not? thanx for help

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090607102105im_/http:/typophile.com/files/EXO_DVD3_4176.jpg)
author: rockberto

comments.content: Unfortunately, this appears to be hand lettered. Look at the “e”s in particular. They are different. If it would be a typeface, they would be identical.
Don’t think so. See e’s and o’s.

I have this suspect... like Ted Nugent logo.  
thanx the same

Just a thought... if I, as a lettering artist, were to have done this I would have had the “cross bar” of the L follow the arc.

I actually think it is a font, or started as one. Plus the D’s are identical... even tho they are different sizes.

But ya know, I could be wrong : )  
Michael

Hey Rocky,

I also think it’s a font, with opentype there are a lot of possibilities——alternates, ligatures, connection strokes——check “house industries” and the movies of the “Robothon” conference. But back to the font, it doesn’t really matter if it’s written or a font because it’s not that good. It’s really inconsistent in spacing, kerning, connection-strokes and countershapes. But I do think it’s a font, a writer that spends time learning this should know the basics that would not result in this.
